alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:23PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurel, southern Jackson and northwestern Clay Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 923 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Green Hill, or 10 miles south of McKee, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shepherdtown around 930 PM EDT. Cornelius and Parrot around 935 PM EDT. Bond and Egypt around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Welchburg, Settle Store, Annville, Deese, Middlefork, Dabolt, Olin, Tyner, Mildred and Zekes Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
